uk.ac.open.crc.intt
Class IdentifierNameTokeniserFactory

java.lang.Object
  uk.ac.open.crc.intt.IdentifierNameTokeniserFactory

public final class IdentifierNameTokeniserFactory
extends java.lang.Object

Provides an API for configuring and creating IdentifierNameTokeniser objects.

The default configuration consists of the default oracle, a set of separator characters ('$' and '_').

The default oracle consists of:

  • A main dictionary composed of 117,000 words from the SCOWL word lists (up to size 70) for English with American and Canadian spelling variants (http://wordlist.sourceforge.net/scowl-readme), with an additional list of 120 computing terms and Java neologisms.
  • A list of 100 common computing abbreviations.
  • A list of 30 abbreviations containing digits.
  • A list of 15 English language prefixes.
  • A list of 60 English language suffixes.

Each component of the oracle may be replaced independently. For example, the main dictionary could be replaced with a word list created using the word lists provided with Ispell.

Alternative separators

Sets of separator characters can be specified to replace the default set of '$' and '_'. e.g. for Lisp the set could be specified as '-' and for R as '.'.

Alternative dictionaries

INTT uses five separate dictionaries, each of which can be replaced using the factory class. The word dictionary, usually large (100,000 entries or so), is specified as a link to a file either in persistent storage or within a jar file. The file should consist of one entry per line. The other four dictionaries are for abbreviations, abbreviations containing digits, prefixes and suffixes. These dictionaries are specified as string arrays because they consist of relatively few terms, e.g. 53 in the default suffix dictionary.

When replacing components of the oracle each component's function should be considered. The main dictionary and the two abbreviations dictionaries are used to support the tokenisation of single case identifier names through the identification of known words or abbreviations. The prefix and suffix dictionaries are used in conjunction with the main dictionary to look for simple neologisms formed by concatenation that do not require morphological changes, e.g. "zoomable" where "zoom" is an entry in the main dictionary and "able" is found in the suffix dictionary. Entries in the suffix and prefix dictionaries should be bound morphemes.

The main dictionary can be replaced with a word list for any natural language where the character set can be represented entirely in UTF-16. The prefix and suffix dictionaries should be replaced accordingly. The tokeniser should then work with languages other than English, with the constraint that morphological rules are not followed when testing for neologisms, only simple concatenation is used.

The project vocabulary is an empty oracle that can be configured to have tokens added during tokenisation (setProjectVocabularyThreshold(int)). The project vocabulary is used in conjunction with the main and abbreviation dictionaries in the tokenisation of single case identifier names. The project vocabulary can also be populated with an initial vocabulary that can be used as a domain- or project-specific dictionary.

Copyright (C) 2011 The Open University

Constructor Detail

IdentifierNameTokeniserFactory

public IdentifierNameTokeniserFactory()
Creates an instance of IdentifierNameTokeniserFactory. The default state is:
  • Oracles - the default set
  • Separators - '$' and '_'
  • Project vocabulary - empty, and disabled.

Throws:
java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the default main dictionary cannot be created. This is most likely the result of a problem with the jar file.

Method Detail

setSeparatorCharacters

public void setSeparatorCharacters(java.lang.String separatorCharacters)
Specifies the set of separator characters to used to separate words in identifier names. The default value is "$_".

Parameters:
separatorCharacters - a String of characters used to separate words in identifier names. The empty string is an acceptable argument and means that no separator characters are used.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - when the argument is null.

setProjectVocabularyThreshold

public void setProjectVocabularyThreshold(int minimumWordLength)
Sets the minimum length of component word to be added to the project vocabulary. Component words with the same number of characters as the threshold are added to the project vocabulary following the tokenisation of an identifier name.

The project vocabulary is used to support the tokenisation of single case identifier names by giving preference to terms used in the same project to resolve ambiguous tokenisations. The project vocabulary is disabled by default.

The threshold prevents short tokens being recorded in the project vocabulary. Large numbers of short tokens can result in oversplitting of single case identifier names.

Parameters:
minimumWordLength - the minimum length of a word to be added to the project vocabulary. 0 allows all words to be added. A negative value turns off the project vocabulary.

setMainDictionarySource

public void setMainDictionarySource(java.io.BufferedReader source)
                             throws java.io.IOException,
                                    java.io.FileNotFoundException
Sets the source of a replacement for the main dictionary. The file or resource referenced should consist of one word per line.

Parameters:
source - an instance of BufferedReader that points to a file either within a jar file or on a storage medium.
Throws:
java.io.IOException - from BufferedReader
java.io.FileNotFoundException - from BufferedReader
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if a null argument is passed to the method.

setDigitAbbreviationsSource

public void setDigitAbbreviationsSource(java.lang.String[] digitAbbreviations)

create

public IdentifierNameTokeniser create()
Creates a new instance of IdentifierNameTokeniser using the current state of the IdentifierNameTokeniserFactory.

Returns:
an instance of IdentifierNameTokeniser.

toString

public java.lang.String toString()
Returns a String representation of the state of the IdentifierNameTokeniserFactory. The string is formatted using the syntax "component-name: field-name=value (, field-name=value)*;" and returns values confirming the status of each major setting.

Main-dictionary:name=Default, entries=117089;
Abbreviation-dictionary:name=Default, entries=103;
Digit-Abbreviation-dictionary:name=Default, entries=50;
Prefix-dictionary:name=Default, entries=15;
Suffix-dictionary:name=Default, entries=57;
Project-vocabulary:threshold=-1;
Separator-character-set: cardinality=2, members={$, _};

Overrides:
toString in class java.lang.Object
Returns:
a formatted String containing the current state of the IdentifierNameTokeniserFactory
